comment.author: 75458835@N00
comment._content: This is Thomas Bayne Denegre, Yale Class of 1915.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Thomas B. Denegre of New Orleans (Yale 1915) owned a rather famous yacht, the Helen (later the Lavengro), from 1926-1944. The schooner was lent to the US Coast Guard at Biloxi during WWII. In recent years (2010) it was restored and is still sailing in the Seattle area. schoonerlavengro.org/history.html

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Captain of the Yale crew in 1914, but didn't race in the first boat against Harvard. See NYT of June 20, 1914. He was re-elected captain for the next year. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D0CE4DA133EE733A... Picture in Yale Archives at images.library.yale.edu/madid/oneItem.aspx?id=1771127

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you all for providing the full name.  We'll fill in the caption and add the date next time we update the record. And thanks to you, swanq for the link to the photo from the Yale archives, a very handsome young man.
